bullets.text: U.S. real average hourly earnings were unchanged in September, signaling stagnant inflation-adjusted wage growth heading into Q4.
BLS canceled the October CPI release, leaving the Fed without key inflation data ahead of its next rate decision.
Treasury yields fell after Fed's Williams hinted at another December rate cut, reinforcing market expectations of continued easing.
Oil prices and energy stocks fell as markets priced lower geopolitical risk from a proposed Russia-Ukraine peace plan push.
Eli Lilly hit $1 trillion market value, underscoring investor conviction in GLP-1 obesity/diabetes drugs' transformative revenue potential.
Samsung's 60% DRAM price hike signals severe global memory tightness, threatening higher costs for AI servers and consumer electronics.
Despite surging Nvidia sales, hyperscalers' custom AI chips intensify competition; AI stock selloff broadens across U.S. and Asian chipmakers.
Google told staff it must double AI serving capacity every six months, highlighting relentless infrastructure demand growth.
Bitcoin's slide toward $80,000 roiled risk assets as Europe readies first 3x leveraged BTC funds, amplifying potential volatility.
China's dominance in critical AI supply-chain materials raises geopolitical risk for U.S. tech and could pressure related stocks.
Satellite imagery shows expanded U.S. Navy deployments near Venezuela, signaling heightened regional vigilance amid political tensions.
FCC moved to scrap telecom cybersecurity rules despite recent Chinese-linked hacks, increasing regulatory risk around network security.
U.S. Energy Department reorganization downgrades renewables and elevates fusion, signaling a notable federal energy policy shift.
California approved a major expansion of Waymo's driverless operations map, advancing autonomous vehicle deployment at scale.
Scientists warn heatwaves will intensify for up to 1,000 years even after net zero, underscoring persistent climate risks.
